item.title: US army launches retaliatory strikes on dozens of ISIL targets in Syria
item.content:encoded: Operation Hawkeye has killed and captured more than 50 ISIL fighters after hitting about 100 targets.

item.title: Real Madrid thrash Real Sociedad 4-1 to move top of La Liga
item.content:encoded: Vinicius Jr strikes twice ⁠from penalty spot as Madrid move provisionally above Barcelona, who play Girona on Monday.

item.title: Onsite gunmen force MSF to stop work at Gaza’s Nasser Hospital
item.content:encoded: Medical charity's announcement comes on the heels of Israel's recent ban on its operations in Gaza.

item.title: Over 100 artists for Palestine back UN’s Albanese after resignation calls
item.content:encoded: UN Special Rapporteur Francesca Albanese faces calls to step down by France and Germany despite debunked remarks.

item.title: Hungary’s Orban says EU bigger threat than Russia before April elections
item.content:encoded: 'Illiberal' PM, endorsed by ally Trump this week, to receive US Secretary of State Marco Rubio on Sunday.

item.title: Helicopter triggers avalanche amid maximum alert across French Alps
item.content:encoded: Emergency teams intentionally triggered an avalanche near a Chamonix ski resort as a safety precaution.

item.title: Palestinian protester Leqaa Kordia calls ICE custody ‘dehumanising’
item.content:encoded: Palestinian Columbia protester Leqaa Kordia says she was chained to a hospital bed after a seizure in ICE custody.

item.title: Cynical Pakistan fans brace for heartbreak in India T20 World Cup match
item.content:encoded: As the match approaches, Pakistani fans hope and pray for their team's unlikely win.

item.title: South Africa’s Markram mauls New Zealand in seven-wicket T20 World Cup win
item.content:encoded: Captain Aiden Markram hits an unbeaten 86 in seven-wicket defeat of New Zealand in Ahmedabad.

item.title: Russia’s Alexey Navalny killed by dart frog poison, European nations allege
item.content:encoded: European nations say findings confirm deadly toxin in Russian opposition leader's body as Moscow demands evidence.

item.title: Iran, US spar as diaspora organises rallies abroad calling for action
item.content:encoded: Iranian families release footage online commemorating loved ones shot during nationwide antigovernment protests.

item.title: Real Madrid vs Real Sociedad 4-1: La Liga – as it happened
item.content:encoded: All the updates as Madrid go provisionally top of La Liga after comfortable victory over Sociedad at the Bernabeu.

item.title: India’s Suryakumar shrugs off rain threat to Pakistan T20 World Cup game
item.content:encoded: Pakistan on Monday reversed their decision to boycott their T20 World Cup match against India, but rain could intervene.

item.title: African Union chair says ‘extermination’ of Palestinians must stop
item.content:encoded: Mahmoud Ali Youssouf, Chairman of African Union Commission, says the "extermination" of the Palestinian people must end.

item.title: Rubio at Munich Security Conference: US wants Europe to be ‘strong’
item.content:encoded: US Secretary of State of Marco Rubio recalled the history between the US and Europe at the Munich Security Conference.

item.title: Deadly drone strikes cloud US-brokered Russia-Ukraine talks in Geneva
item.content:encoded: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy and US Secretary of State Marco Rubio hint at difficulties in next week's talks.

item.title: Bangladeshi PM-in-waiting urges opposition to work with BNP
item.content:encoded: Bangladeshi Prime Minister-in-waiting Tarique Rahman urged opposition parties to work with the incoming BNP government.

item.title: England beat Scotland to get T20 World Cup bid back on track
item.content:encoded: England beat Scotland by five wickets in India to recover position in group at 2026 T20 World Cup.

item.title: Swear words fly as cheating allegations made in curling at Winter Olympics
item.content:encoded: Two of curling's best men's teams, Sweden and Canada, involved in fiery and controversial match at Winter Olympics.

item.title: ICU patients’ lives at risk in Gaza’s Al-Aqsa Hospital amid Israel’s war
item.content:encoded: The hospital may be forced in the coming hours to ration electricity so that certain wards can be prioritised.

item.title: India vs Pakistan match is a godsend for T20 World Cup hosts Sri Lanka
item.content:encoded: Sri Lanka braced itself for massive losses after Pakistan's boycott call, but now awaits a thrilling clash on Sunday.

item.title: Winter Olympics hit by another suspected sabotage of rail services
item.content:encoded: Italy's Transport Minister Matteo Salvini says 'lives at risk' as services between Milano Cortina Games hit.

item.title: T20 World Cup: Pakistan ‘always ready’ for India despite late green light
item.content:encoded: Both teams say they are set for Sunday's showdown despite the late decision for India's match with Pakistan to proceed.

item.title: Two hurt after high-speed New Zealand-France crash at Auckland SailGP race
item.content:encoded: Two sailors treated for serious injuries after Black Foils and DS ⁠Team France involved in major collision.

item.title: Are lasers the future of anti-drone warfare?
item.content:encoded: Repelling mass drone strikes is a hard and expensive task, but lasers might help.
